New Records: Stephen Curry scored a season-high 37 points
Kevon Looney grabbed nine offensive rebounds in 15 minutes off the bench, becoming the third player to record at least nine offensive rebounds in 15 minutes-or-less in league history
Key Match Events: Stephen Curry scored the final 12 points for the Warriors to will them to a 120-117 victory over Klay Thompson and the Dallas Mavericks
Curry's 28-foot step-back 3-pointer with 27.5 seconds left gave the Warriors a four-point lead
Klay Thompson poured in 13 years of legendary moments with the Warriors organization and Tuesday was his first game back at Chase Center since his departure to the Mavericks
Pre-Game Insights: The Emirates NBA Cup opener carried extra significance
Curry carried a fiery passion in his play on both ends of the court
Post-Match Reflections: The Warriors improved to 3-1 at home on the season
Golden State improved to 7-1 in games against the NBA’s Western Conference
The team’s record of 9-2 through 11 games marks their best start since the 2021-22 season (10-1)
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Warriors have won two of their last three meetings vs. the Mavericks, with all three contests decided by four points-or-less
Tonight marked the first of three matchups for Golden State vs. Dallas this season
The Warriors have won three of their last four games vs. the Mavericks played at Chase Center
Others: The Warriors trailed by as many as 11 points and went on to win, marking the team’s third double-figure comeback victory on the season
Stephen Curry tallied a season-high 37 points, his second consecutive game posting a season-high mark
Tonight marked the Warriors 522nd consecutive sellout, the third-longest active streak in the NBA
